page.title: 01Great Asby, nr. Appleby
page.content: Great Asby Gt.Asby lies 5 miles from the county town of Appleby-in-Westmorland. It is an area dominated by farming. The land is gently hilly with mainly improved or rough pastures. There is an equal mix of sheep and cattle farming, and milk herds tend to predominate.In this particular area there is no other industry. The climate is relatively mild for a northern area, because it is sheltered by the Pennines to the east and the Lake District Hills to the west. Dry stone walls, stone built houses, meandering streams and roads and great quietness make this area attractive for holidaymakers and retired people, but not to the same extent as the Lake District.
